It functions in the same manner as its unimbued variant (with the 16.67% Melee bonus), except that it also provides an extra 15% boost to Ranged accuracy and Ranged damage, and a 15% boost to Magic accuracy and Magic damage, against monsters assigned as the player's slayer task.

The Slayer helmet (i), requiring a Defence level of 10 to wear, is a piece of equipment that is worn in the helmet slot. It provides the bonuses of multiple pieces of protective and beneficial Slayer equipment. It functions in the same manner as its unimbued variant (with the 16.67% Melee bonus), except that it also provides an extra 15% boost to Ranged accuracy and Ranged damage, and a 15% boost to Magic accuracy and Magic damage, against monsters assigned as the player's slayer task.

Players can imbue the slayer helmet using 1,250,000 Nightmare Zone reward points or 500 Soul Wars Zeal Tokens. This can be done to a black mask before assembling the Slayer helmet or to the Slayer helmet itself. If the imbued helmet is disassembled, a black mask (i) will be returned to the player along with the other components.

For players with undead Slayer tasks, the boosts given by the Salve amulet or Salve amulet (e) do not stack with the effects of a Slayer helmet (i).

When using obsidian weapons the effect of a berserker necklace does stack with the effects of a slayer helmet (i).

The defensive bonuses of the Slayer helmet (i) are equivalent to those of the Rune full helm, with the exception of providing +11 higher relative magic defence (+10 vs. -1) as well as positive Magic and Ranged attack bonuses.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
14 July 2021
(update | poll)

The item was graphically updated.

26 May 2016
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was adjusted with the release of recoloured helmets.

11 February 2016
(update)

The "Check" option was added, allowing players to see their current Slayer task.

20 February 2014
(update | poll)
  • The Slayer helm (i)[sic] and all versions of the black mask (i) now offer a 15% damage boost to Magic damage against your assigned Slayer target, like they already do for melee and Ranging.
  • The Slayer helm (i)[sic] now has a +3 mage attack bonus, a +3 range attack bonus and a +10 mage defence bonus.
  • The Slayer helm's[sic] chathead model has had a green tint removed from its jaw.
16 January 2014
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 90,000.

Date unknown

The slayer helmet (i) is now kept on death as with other untradeable items. Previously, all components of the helmet would disappear and the black mask would appear on the ground.

It provides the bonuses of multiple pieces of protective and beneficial [[Slayer]] equipment. It functions in the same manner as its [[Slayer helmet|unimbued variant]] (with the 16.67% [[Melee]] bonus), except that it also provides an extra 15% boost to [[Ranged]] accuracy '''and''' Ranged damage, and a 15% boost to [[Magic]] accuracy '''and''' Magic damage, against monsters assigned as the player's slayer task. Players can imbue the slayer helmet using 1,250,000 [[Nightmare Zone]] reward points or 500 [[Soul Wars]] Zeal Tokens. This can be done to a [[black mask]] before assembling the Slayer helmet or to the [[Slayer helmet]] itself. If the imbued helmet is disassembled, a [[black mask (i)]] will be returned to the player along with the other components. For players with undead [[Slayer task]]s, the boosts given by the [[Salve amulet]] or [[Salve amulet (e)]] do '''not''' stack with the effects of a Slayer helmet (i). When using [[obsidian weapons]] the effect of a [[berserker necklace]] '''does''' stack with the effects of a slayer helmet (i).
